column1: • Develop mentoring, career advancement and succession planning programs for staff in order to increase efficiency and productivity.

• Take care of employment contracts while developing compensation and benefits policies across the company and work closely with the finance department to make sure payroll and employee benefits are correct throughout the business.
• Provide proper guidance and advise employees on work place ethic and behavioral change management.
• Provide counseling and advisory services to employees regarding employee relations issues, concerns or any other matters affecting employment.
• Work collaboratively with other departments and management to facilitate and advance employee success and personal growth.
• Provide learning and development training across the group of companies.
• Perform other related tasks as assigned by the management.
• Bachelors in Business Administration, Psychology or equivalent.
<li>Minimum 4 years experience in employee relations, employee welfare with broad human resource experience, preferably from Oil &amp
- over 200 staff in Singapore and Myanmar with a mixture of expat, repat and local (operations and management side)
